law.catch_line: A juvenile court may enter an order for a child's adoption under this Part IV of this subtitle only ...

text.section:
A juvenile court may enter an order for a child's adoption under this Part IV of this subtitle only if:
for an individual under the age of 18 years, the individual's guardian consents; and
for an individual who is at least 10 years old, the individual consents.

section.section:
A guardian may not withhold consent for the sole reason that:
the race, religion, color, or national origin of a prospective adoptive parent differs from that of the child or parent; or
a prospective adoptive parent has a disability.
